# Internet Assigned Numbers Authority
# Internet Assigned Numbers Authority
The global coordination of the DNS Root, IP addressing, and other Internet protocol resources is performed as the Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) functions. [Learn more.](https://iana.org/about)
## [Domain Names](https://iana.org/domains)
Management of the DNS Root Zone (assignments of ccTLDs and gTLDs) along with other functions such as the .int and .arpa zones.
-   [Root Zone Management](https://iana.org/domains/root)
-   [Database of Top Level Domains](https://iana.org/domains/root/db)
-   [.int Registry](https://iana.org/domains/int)
-   [.arpa Registry](https://iana.org/domains/arpa)
-   [IDN Practices Repository](https://iana.org/domains/idn-tables)
## [Number Resources](https://iana.org/numbers)
Coordination of the global IP and AS number spaces, such as allocations made to Regional Internet Registries.
-   [IP Addresses & AS Numbers](https://iana.org/numbers)
-   [Network abuse information](https://iana.org/abuse)
## [Protocol Assignments](https://iana.org/protocols)
The central repository for protocol name and number registries used in many Internet protocols.
-   [Protocol Registries](https://iana.org/protocols)
-   [Apply for an assignment](https://iana.org/protocols/apply)
-   [Time Zone Database](https://iana.org/time-zones)
